data.title: Dutch players with Indonesian heritage
data.meta_description: I was wondering which Dutch players who are playing in the Dutch Eredivisie or other top divisions around the world that have parents or grandparents...
data.text:
I was wondering which Dutch players who are playing in the Dutch Eredivisie or other top divisions around the world that have parents or grandparents from Indonesia.

Players that i have heard of who have Indonesian heritage are:

John Heitinga - Ajax

Demy De Zeeuw - AZ Alkmaar

Jeffrey Altheer - Excelsior

Giovanni Van Bronkhorst - Feyenoord

Roy Makaay - Feyenoord

Michael Mols - Feyenoord

Jhon Van Beukering - NEC

Charles Dissels - NEC

Michael Timiselu - VVV Venlo

Jason Oost - VVV Venlo

Robin Van Persie - Arsenal, England

Wilfred Bouma - Aston Villa, England

Denny Landzaat - Wigan, England

Bobby Petta - Adelaide, Australia

Jeffrey Leiwakabessy - Aachen, Germany (2nd div)

Jeffrey De Visscher - Aberdeen, Scotland

Also players with Suriname heritage who also have Indonesian heritage:

Hedwiges Maduro - Ajax

Sigourney Bandjar - Excelsior

Delano Hill - Willem II

Also one Belgium player with Indonesian heritage is:

Radja Nainggolan - Piacenza, Italy (2nd div)

Does anyone know of any other players with Indonesian heritage in the Dutch Eredivisie or other top European leagues?

Also please make any corrections if i've made any mistakes.

The only ones I'm 100% certain about being of 100% Indonesian heritage are Bobby Petta, Denny Landzaat, Michael Mols and Gio van Bronckhorst. The latter two are actually of Moluccan descent - the Moluccan islands are stil fighting for their independence from Indonesia so I thought I'd mention it. One of Heitinga's parents is Indonesian. Van Persie I believe has an Indonesian grandmother but he also has Surinamese blood.

Often when you think a Dutch player looks of Indonesian descent, what he actually is is Hindustan-Surinam. In colonial times, the Dutch recruited thousands of people from the Indian province of Hindustan to work on the Surinamese plantations. Many people of Hindustan-Surinamese descent have since settled in the Netherlands.

End of the day all of them are as Dutch as Gouda cheese of course.

Wow, this really comes as a big surprise, i knew that almost all those players werent totally dutch, but i never thought they were of indo.. descent. I thought players like Oost, Bouma, Landzaat were mulattos.

Maduro isn't suriname he's Aruban. and i dunno about bouma he has some ebo-features. i thought he was half Antilian.

i dunno who u mean with charles dissels. i only know one, he plays at sparta and has no indo blood for all i know.

of course we also have a coach with indonesian decent. ANDRE WETZEL

i know there are more players with indo-blood, but its hard to tell who exactly.

i think Cocu and Ruud van Nistelrooy have Indonesian heritage.

That's right, there is no Indonesion heritage, as Indonesia only came into existance when the parents of these players were of Dutch nationality as inhabitants of the former Dutch East Indies. It isnot so strange that there are so many, as the number of people that has Dutch Indies roots are about ten percent of the population. You also cannot distinguish them from "normal" Dutch by looking at them as the big(ger) part of them are blond and blue, green or grey eyed. The Moluccan are a special case, as they declared an independent state, that was overrun by the Indonesion state. So they had no nationality when they arrived in the Netherlands. But they too are of Dutch indies origin, and not Indonesian!!!

I found this topic by accident but I have to say there are Surinamese players with Indonesian background.

There are many people in Suriname from Javanese descent!

Many Surinamese people are mixed, but they look like they are from African descent, but they have a little bit of Chinese eyes, and a Chinese last name or some Portugese, Jewish or Dutch blood or Javanese in them. Like Humberto Tan has I Chinese last name but he doesn't look Chinese.

The players of Indonesian descent in Holland almost all have Dutch blood in them, the rich Dutch people there had Indonesian women.

The Moluccan players are often more 'pure blooded' they often were soldiers for the Dutch Indonesian Army in exchange for getting an independent Maluku (which they never got), but also sometimes they have some Portugese blood or some other.
